alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Vernon Parish in west central Louisiana and northern Newton Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 414 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Hornbeck, or 14 miles northwest of Anacoco, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Leesville, Anacoco, Toledo Bend Dam, Burkeville, Fort Johnson, New Llano, Hornbeck, Farrsville, Burr Ferry, Mayflower, Wiergate, Evans, and Pickering. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
